abstract: Mitch Lasky, who as chief executive of Jamdat led the company to the top of the cellphone-games market, is leaving his post as head of Electronic Arts‘s mobile-games unit to join Benchmark Capital as a general partner. The move suggests that Benchmark, a Silicon Valley venture firm that just celebrated the sale of portfolio company Tellme Networks to Microsoft, will be considering more investments in gaming startups.
lead_paragraph: Mitch Lasky, who as chief executive of Jamdat led the company to the top of the cellphone-games market, is leaving his post as head of Electronic Arts‘s mobile-games unit to join Benchmark Capital as a general partner. The move suggests that Benchmark, a Silicon Valley venture firm that just celebrated the sale of portfolio company Tellme Networks to Microsoft, will be considering more investments in gaming startups.

headline.main: Benchmark Signals Gaming Plays With New Hire
